result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob H. Allred was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: May serve in Monroe Co.  DE has 4 days credit if probation revoked.  W/O Good Time.

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent include Compass program.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Absolute Sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Jacob H. Allred in court with attorney Brent W. Varner.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have rec/rev copies of the PSI w/no corrections to be made.  State makes recommendation.  Atty Varner agrees.  DE agrees.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE of voting rights and felony firearm warnings and appeal rights.

Ct 1:  
Probation for 3 years
Conditions of probation:
180 days jail w/huber privileges but w/o good time consecutive to any other sentence
To commence on or before 1/9/2015 at 6:30 pm unless agent directs otherwise
EMP approved per jail rules and w/agent's discretion
May serve in Monroe Co if accepted and w/agent's approved
Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances w/o valid prescription
DE to notify agent w/in 2 working days if prescription is received
AODA/Treatment/Programming per Compass program and any other per agent
Seek/maintain full-time employment
Pay supervision fees per agent
DNA sample to be provided

Defendant Jacob H. Allred in court with attorney Brent W. Varner.  John A. Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties agree to plea and order PSI.  Plea free, knowingly and voluntarily.  Factual basis to plea in complaint.  No contest plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court orders PSI.  Report to be done by Oct. 31, 2014.

Defendant Jacob H. Allred appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb O'Rourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE does qualify for PD representation.  State requests $500.00 Cash bond.  Atty. ORourke requests PA bond and makes bail argument.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  Court sets $1000.00 Signature bond.  Special bond conditions as follows: No possession of controlled substance w/o valid prescription.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
